intro: Leucas mackinderi, commonly known as Mackinder's leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
